data.name: Everyday Access Plus
data.description: A secondary Everyday Access account with everything you need to do your daily banking.

features.additionalInfo: Leave your wallet behind and pay for the things you need with Apple Pay.
With Bpay View, you can see and pay your bills through Internet Banking.

Use instore, online and withdraw local currency at millions of locations, everywhere Visa is accepted. Cards are enabled to support diverse needs with raised bumps on the left hand-side on the front face of the card.
You can self-serve your day-to-day banking needs via Bank Australia's App, Internet Banking or Phone Banking.
Leave your wallet behind and pay for the things you need with Samsung Pay.
Notifications can be enabled in the App or through Internet Banking, allowing you to be alerted either by email, sms or through the App about your card/account activity.
Leave your wallet behind and pay for the things you need with Google Pay.

Decide the features you want enabled on your card including card lock, digital wallet, pay wave, international transactions, ATM withdrawals or online/instore transactions and simply switch them on or off from your App or Internet Banking.

When you make a transaction with your Visa debit card, you can decide whether you want the amount to be rounded to the nearest whole dollar amount, with the round up being credited from this account into your nominated Savings account or Credit Card.
With PayID you can forget your BSB and account number – simply use your mobile, email or ABN to receive payments. This account can be linked to a PayID.
There is no limit to the number of online, EFTPOS, ATM or staff assisted transactions you can make.

eligibility.additionalValue: Must be an Australian citizen, permanent resident or have a valid Visa.
Natural Person or In trust for a Natural Person or Non-Individual entity

eligibility.additionalInfo: Available to personal customers that already hold an everyday access transaction account.

fees.name: Foreign Currency Conversion fee
fees.additionalInfo:
We charge 3% of the value when you make a transaction that is converted by Visa from a foreign currency to Australian dollars and includes purchases made, overseas, in a currency other than Australian dollars, where the merchant is located overseas; or
where the financial institution or entity processing the transaction is located overseas.

fees.name: Exceeding available funds fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged on accounts when your balance falls below zero or your negative balance exceeds any agreed overdraft limit. Additional interest is charged on overdrawn amounts.

discounts.description: We won't charge you a monthly account fee if this criteria is met

eligibility.additionalInfo: You have a Bank Australia Premium Home Loan package

discounts.description: We won't charge you a fee if this criteria is met
discounts.additionalInfo: Deposit at least $2000 a month and you will not be charged a Monthly Account Fee.

fees.name: Cheque book fee
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is for the purchase of a personal cheque book. $35 for a book of 50 and $70 for a book of 100.

fees.name: Cheque book fee
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is for the purchase of a personal cheque book. $35 for a book of 50 and $70 for a book of 100.

fees.name: Visa Foreign Cash Withdrawal Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee that applies to any cash withdrawal transaction made with your Bank Australia Visa Debit Card outside Australia.

fees.name: Domestic (“press credit”) cash withdrawal fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged to any cash withdrawal transaction within Australia made using the “credit” option on a Visa Debit card.

fees.name: Dishonour fee
fees.additionalInfo: When we dishonour a cheque or debit presented to us because there isn't enough money in your account
